result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J LaPean was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same
***May 19, 2014, Judge Flanagan Br. 4; ORDER COMMUTING TERM OF PROBATION TO THREE (3) YEARS/Stat. 973.09(2)(b).

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or civil judgment.

Obtain GED/HSED.
Obtain and maintain employment.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with victim, Cheryl L., without prior court approval.

Successfully complete "Batterers Intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Restitution is set at zero.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Particiapte in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J LaPean

Defendant Robert J LaPean not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Letter to the Defense Counsel, ADA Copied.

Defendant Robert J LaPean in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Robert J LaPean in court with Attorney Christoher Ertl.  William Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Z. Berry for DOC agent Matthew Drall also in court.
The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  The Court ordered the stay on the condition time to continue until the next court date.  
Case adjourned to 11-14-2014 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 4.

Court defers on defense motion to modify the no contact order.   mld

Commuting Term of Probation, signed and filed.
-- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the term of probation is commuted to three years.   mld
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mel Flanagan, Br. 4, for review. jbs
Letter from DOC seeking review of excessive probationary term.

Defendant Robert J LaPean in court with attorney Christopher J Ertl.  Defendant Robert J LaPean in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Cheryl L. 

 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, with credit for 67 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 42 MONTHS with the following conditions:  
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 4 MONTHS 
   in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH. 
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days 
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.  
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Cheryl L., without prior court approval.   
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of probation 
   or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 9-12-2014 AT 1:30 PM.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
 Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.   mld

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Robert J LaPean not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-23-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, breathalyzer tests, absolute sobriety.  Release for verified employment and court.   mld
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.   mld

Defendant Robert J LaPean in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Robert J LaPean in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to both counts.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery and a written offer from the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-27-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CHERYL  L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Robert J LaPean in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Robert J LaPean in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
